meanings.definition: The angle formed by the meeting of two surfaces, typically referring to the lower edge of a bird's beak.
meanings.sent1: The bird expert pointed out the gonys of the eagle's beak.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the gonys of various bird species.
meanings.sent3: The curious parrot tried to balance a seed on its gonys.

meanings.sent5: The gonys of the pelican's beak helped it catch fish efficiently.

meanings.definition: The corner or angle of a polygon.
meanings.sent1: The square has four equal gonys.
meanings.sent2: The mathematician calculated the gonys of the hexagon.
meanings.sent3: The artist painted each gonys of the shape in a different color.
meanings.sent4: The gonys of the triangle pointed towards the center.
meanings.sent5: The gonys of the pentagon formed a perfect angle.

meanings.definition: The point where two lines meet to form an angle.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter measured the gonys of the corner before cutting.

meanings.sent3: The gonys of the intersection looked like a tiny arrow.

meanings.sent5: The gonys of the angle was crucial for the construction project.
